alert.note: Alert for Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tioga County through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Owego, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Owego, Candor, Spencer, Willseyville, Tioga Center, Jenksville, North Spencer, West Candor, Catatonk and Speedville. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 near 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
